intro: Pterocephalodes siamensis, commonly known as the Siam spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in open woodlands and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a garden plant.
